page.title: 04All Saints Church, Denmead.
page.content: One of the centres of village life is All Saints Church. This was built in 1880 in the Early English style when the Parish boundaries were being redefined. It is built from local flint and stone from Bath. The design of the Church is very simple having only a Nave, Sanctuary and Vestries (added in 1959). However there are some interesting features. Near the door is the Font. This was given to All Saints by its parent Church, St. Peter and St. Paul, Hambledon, in 1880. It is of 13th or 14th century origin. Another feature we would not expect to find in a Victorian Church is a Rood Screen. Windows in the Church are nearly all Memorial windows. They remember former Vicars, Schoolmasters, those who gave ground for the Church and those who fell in two World Wars.
